text: Adam fathered Seth, who fathered Enosh,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Kenan, who fathered Mahalalel, who fathered Jared,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Enoch, who fathered Methuselah, who fathered Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Noah, who fathered Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Japheth’s descendants were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gomer’s descendants were Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Javan’s descendants were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ham’s descendants were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Cush’s descendants were Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca.
Raamah’s descendants were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cush fathered Nimrod. He became the first powerful ruler on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mitzraim fathered the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim (from whom the Philistines descended), and the Caphtorim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn, as well as Heth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Hivites, the Archites, the Sinites,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shem’s descendants were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arpachshad fathered Shelah and Shelah fathered Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eber fathered two sons. The name of the one was Peleg (because the earth was divided during his lifetime) and his brother was named Joktan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab—all of these were Joktan’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: In summary, Shem fathered Arpachshad, who fathered Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Eber, who fathered Peleg, who fathered Reu,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Serug, who fathered Nahor, who fathered Terah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who fathered Abram—that is, Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham’s descendants were Isaac and Ishmael.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are their genealogies: the firstborn Ishmael fathered Nebaioth, and then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah—these are the Ishmaelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants born to Keturah, Abraham’s mistress, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The descendants of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the descendants of Keturah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham fathered Isaac. Isaac’s descendants were Esau and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Esau’s descendants were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliphaz’s descendants were Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reuel’s descendants were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seir’s descendants were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lotan’s descendants were Hori and Homam. Lotan’s sister was Timna.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shobal’s descendants were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam.
Zibeon’s descendants were Aiah and Anah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Anah’s descendant was Dishon.
Dishon’s descendants were Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ezer’s descendants were Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan.
Dishan’s descendants were Uz and Aran.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here’s a list of kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelis, beginning with Beor’s son Bela (his city was named Dinhabah).
speaker: Narrator

text: After Bela died, Zerah’s son Jobab from Bozrah succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Husham died, Bedad’s son Hadad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, succeeded him. His city was named Avith.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates River succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Shaul died, Achbor’s son Baal-hanan succeeded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Baal-hanan died, Hadad succeeded him. His city was named Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel. She was the daughter of Matred, who was the daughter of Me-zahab.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Hadad died.
The chiefs of Edom included the chiefs of Timna, Aliah, Jetheth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Magdiel, and Iram—these are the clans of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here’s a list of Israel’s sons: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah’s three sons Er, Onan, and Shelah were born to him through Bath-shua, a Canaanite. Er, Judah’s firstborn, became wicked in the Lord’s sight, so he put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah’s daughter-in-law Tamar also bore him Perez and Zerah, so Judah had five sons in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Perez’s sons were Hezron and Hamul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zerah had five sons in all: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carmi’s son was Achar, who became Israel’s troublemaker by transgressing the Lord’s commandment regarding things that were to be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ethan’s son was Azariah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezron’s sons born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ram fathered Amminadab, and Amminadab fathered Nahshon, who was leader of the descendants of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nahshon fathered Salma, Salma fathered Boaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Boaz fathered Obed, and Obed fathered Jesse.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesse fathered Eliab his firstborn, Abinadab his second born, Shimea his third born,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel his fourth born, Raddai his fifth born,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ozem his sixth born, David his seventh born;
speaker: Narrator

text:
along with their sisters Zeruiah and Abigail.
Zeruiah’s three sons were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abigail bore Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezron’s son Caleb had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. These were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hur fathered Uri, and Uri fathered Bezalel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, Hezron married the daughter of Machir, who had fathered Gilead. He married her when he was 60 years old, and she bore him Segub.
speaker: Narrator

text: Segub fathered Jair, who had 23 towns in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Geshur and Aram took 60 towns from Gilead, including Havvoth-jair and Kenath, along with their villages. All these were descendants of Machir, who fathered Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah wife of Hezron bore him Ashhur, who fathered Tekoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jerahmeel also had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Ram, firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Onam’s descendants were Shammai and Jada.
Shammai’s descendants were Nadab and Abishur.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail. She bore him Ahban and Molid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab’s descendants were Seled and Appaim. Seled died childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Appaim’s son was Ishi. Ishi’s son was Sheshan. Sheshan’s son was Ahlai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammai’s brother Jada’s descendants were Jether and Jonathan, but Jether died childless.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonathan’s descendants were Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. However, Sheshan had an Egyptian slave named Jarha.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his slave Jarha, and she bore him Attai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai fathered Nathan, and Nathan fathered Zabad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zabad fathered Ephlal, Ephlal fathered Obed,
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed fathered Jehu, Jehu fathered Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Helez, Helez fathered Eleasah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleasah fathered Sismai, Sismai fathered Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum fathered Jekamiah, and Jekamiah fathered Elishama.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerahmeel’s brother Caleb’s descendants were his firstborn Mesha, who fathered Ziph.
The descendants of Mareshah, who fathered Hebron, were as follows:
speaker: Narrator

text: Hebron’s descendants were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shema fathered Raham, who fathered Jorkeam.
Rekem fathered Shammai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammai’s descendants included Maon, who fathered Beth-zur.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Caleb’s mistress Ephah also bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez.
Haran fathered Gazez.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jahdai’s descendants were Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb’s mistress Maacah bore Sheber, Tirhanah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shaaph, who fathered Madmannah. Sheva fathered Machbenah and Gibe. Caleb’s daughter was Achsah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were Caleb’s descendants.
The son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, was Shobal, who fathered Kiriath-jearim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma, who fathered Bethlehem, and Hareph, who fathered Beth-gader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal, who fathered Kiriath-jearim, had other sons, including Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of Kiriath-jearim included the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. The Zorathites and the Eshtaolites came from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salma’s descendants were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The families of the scribes who lived at Jabez included the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, who fathered the house of Rechab.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are David’s descendants who were born to him in Hebron: Amnon his firstborn by Ahinoam the Jezreelite, Daniel his second born by Abigail the Carmelite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Absalom his third born by Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur, Adonijah his fourth born by Haggith,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shephatiah his fifth born by Abital, and Ithream his sixth born by his wife Eglah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These six were born to him in Hebron, where he reigned for seven years and six months.
He reigned 33 years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: These four children were born to David by Bath-shua daughter of Ammiel while he was living in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: followed by nine more: Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were David’s sons, besides children born to his mistresses. Tamar was their sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon’s descendants included Rehoboam, his son Abijah, his son Asa, his son Jehoshaphat,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Joram, his son Ahaziah, his son Joash,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Amaziah, his son Azariah, his son Jotham,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Ahaz, his son Hezekiah, his son Manasseh,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Amon, and his son Josiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Josiah’s descendants included Johanan his firstborn, his second born Jehoiakim, his third born Zedekiah, and his fourth born Shallum.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiakim’s descendants included his son Jeconiah, and his son Zedekiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Jeconiah, who was taken captive to Babylon, included his son Shealtiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pedaiah’s descendants included Zerubbabel and Shimei.
Zerubbabel’s descendants included Meshullam and Hananiah, along with Shelomith their sister
speaker: Narrator

text: and five others: Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah’s descendants included Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, his son Rephaiah, his son Arnan, his son Obadiah, and his son Shecaniah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shecaniah’s son was Shemaiah, and the six sons of Shemaiah were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The three sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seven sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judah’s descendants were Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shobal’s son Reaiah fathered Jahath, and Jahath fathered Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the descendants of the ancestor of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and their sister’s name was Hazzelelponi.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Penuel fathered Gedor and Ezer fathered Hushah.
These were the descendants of Hur, Ephrathah’s firstborn, who fathered Bethlehem:
speaker: Narrator

text: Tekoa’s father Ashhur had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naarah bore him these sons: Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Koz fathered Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Harum’s son Aharhel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jabez enjoyed more honor than his relatives—his mother named him Jabez, she said, “because I bore him in pain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Later on, Jabez called on the God of Israel, asking him, “…whether you would bless me again and again, enlarge my territory, keep your power with me, keep me from evil, and keep me from harm!” And God granted what he had requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chelub, Shuhah’s brother, fathered Mehir, who fathered Eshton.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eshton fathered Beth-rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah, who fathered Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kenaz’s descendants were Othniel and Seraiah.
Othniel’s descendants were Hathath
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Meonothai, who fathered Ophrah.
Seraiah fathered Joab, who fathered the Ge-harashim, because they became artisans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The descendants of Jephunneh’s son Caleb were Iru, Elah, and Naam.
Elah’s son was Kenaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehallelel’s descendants were Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ezrah’s descendants were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon.
Mered’s wife conceived Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah, who fathered Eshtemoa.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his Judean wife bore Jered, who fathered Gedor and then Heber, who fathered Soco and Jekuthiel, who fathered Zanoah. These are the descendants of Bithiah, daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Hodiah’s wife, Naham’s sister, fathered Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shimon’s descendants were Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon.
Ishi’s descendants were Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Judah’s son Shelah were Er, who fathered Lecah, Laadah (who fathered Mareshah and the families who belonged to the guild of linen workers at Beth-ashbea),
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokim, the men who lived in Cozeba, Joash, and Saraph (who married Moabite families), and Jashubi-lehem. (The records are ancient.)
speaker: Narrator

text: These people were potters who lived in Netaim and Gederah in service to their king, who lived there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon’s descendants were Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Shallum, his son Mibsam, and his son Mishma.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishma’s descendants were his son Hammuel, his son Zaccur, and his son Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei had 16 sons and six daughters, but his relatives did not have many children, nor did their entire family multiply like the Judeans did.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Beer-sheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until David began to reign.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their cities were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan, for a total of five cities,
speaker: Narrator

text:
along with all their settlements that surrounded these cities as far as Baal—this is their settlement history.
They kept this genealogical record for themselves:
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshobab, Jamlech, Amaziah’s son Joshah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel, Joshibiah’s son Jehu (who was the grandson of Seraiah and great-grandson of Asiel),
speaker: Narrator

text: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shiphi’s son Ziza (who was the grandson of Shiphi, who was fathered by Allon, who was fathered by Jedaiah, who was fathered by Shimri, who was fathered by Shemaiah)—
speaker: Narrator

text: these people, enumerated by name, were leaders in their respective families, and their clans grew to be very abundant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They journeyed as far as the entrance of Gedor on the east side of the valley in order to find pasture for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They discovered abundant and excellent grazing lands there, where the land was very broad, secure, and tranquil, because the former inhabitants there were descendants of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later on, during the reign of King Hezekiah of Judah, these people, enumerated by name, came and attacked both their homes and the Meunim who had settled there and who remain exterminated to this day. They settled down there, taking their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them—that is, 500 Simeonite men—went to Mount Seir. Under the leadership of Ishi’s sons Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel,
speaker: Narrator

text: they destroyed the survivors of the Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here is a record of the descendants of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn. (He was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father’s marriage bed, his birthright was transferred to the descendants of Israel’s son Joseph. As a result, Reuben is not enrolled in the genealogy according to the birthright.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even though Judah became prominent among his relatives—that is, the Commander-in-chief will be his descendant—nevertheless the right of the firstborn went to Joseph.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, included Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel’s descendants were his son Shemaiah, his son Gog, his son Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Micah, his son Reaiah, his son Baal,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his son Beerah, whom King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria carried away into exile, and who was a governor of the descendants of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: His relatives, listed by families when the genealogy was enrolled according to their generations, included the chief, Jeiel, Zechariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azaz’s son Bela, grandson of Shema, and great-grandson of Joel, who lived in Aroer, near Nebo and Baal-meon.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also lived eastward as far as the entrance to the wilderness this side of the Euphrates River, because their cattle had increased in the territory of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the reign of Saul they declared war on the Hagrites, who fell in battle by their hand. They lived in their tents throughout all of east Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gad’s descendants lived beside them in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah:
speaker: Narrator

text: They included Joel their chief, Shapham their second in command, Janai, and Shaphat, who lived in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their seven relatives, according to the households of their clans, included Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the descendants of Huri’s son Abihail, who was fathered by Jaroah, who was fathered by Gilead, who was fathered by Michael, who was fathered by Jeshishai, who was fathered by Jahdo, and who was fathered by Buz:
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdiel’s son Ahi, who was the grandson of Guni, was chief in their clan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its villages, and in all the surrounding suburbs of Sharon as far as their borders.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of them were enrolled by genealogies during the reign of King Jotham of Judah and during the reign of King Jeroboam of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh produced 44,700 valiant soldiers expert in shield, sword, and bow. Trained in warfare, they were equipped to serve at a moment’s notice.
speaker: Narrator

text: They fought in battle against the Hagrites, Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they received assistance against them, the Hagrites and all of their allies were handed over to their control, because they cried out to God during the battle. He honored their entreaty, because they had placed their trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They captured 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys, and 100,000 war captives from their possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many fell slain, because the battle’s outcome was directed by God. They lived in their territory until the exile.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land, spread out from Bashan to Baal-hermon, including Senir and Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the leaders of their clans: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel—they were mighty warriors, well known men, and leaders of their clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors by prostituting themselves to the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had exterminated right in front of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the God of Israel incited King Pul of Assyria (also known as King Tiglath-pileser of Assyria), who took them prisoner and brought the descendants of Reuben, the descendants of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the Gozan River, where they remain to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Levi’s descendants included Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kohath’s sons included Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amram’s descendants included Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. Aaron’s sons included Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar fathered Phinehas, Phinehas fathered Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua fathered Bukki, Bukki fathered Uzzi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi fathered Zerahiah, Zerahiah fathered Meraioth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Meraioth fathered Amariah, Amariah fathered Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Ahimaaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahimaaz fathered Azariah, Azariah fathered Johanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Johanan fathered Azariah, who served as priest in the Temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Amariah, Amariah fathered Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahitub fathered Zadok, Zadok fathered Shallum,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shallum fathered Hilkiah, Hilkiah fathered Azariah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azariah fathered Seraiah, and Seraiah fathered Jehozadak.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord sent Jehozadak, Judah, and Jerusalem into exile, using Nebuchadnezzar to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Levi’s descendants included Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of Gershom’s descendants: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kohath’s sons included Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Merari’s sons included Mahli and Mushi.
These are the clans of the descendants of Levi according to their ancestry:
speaker: Narrator

text: Gershom’s clan included his son Libni, his son Jahath, his son Zimmah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Joah, his son Iddo, his son Zerah, and his son Jeatherai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kohath’s descendants included Amminadab, his son Korah, his son Assir,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Elkanah, his son Ebiasaph, his son Assir,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Tahath, his son Uriel, his son Uzziah, and his son Shaul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah’s descendants included Amasai and Ahimoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Elkanah, his son Zophai, his son Nahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Eliab, his son Jeroham, and his son Elkanah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Samuel’s descendants included Joel his firstborn and his second son Abijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Merari’s descendants included Mahli, his son Libni, his son Shimei, his son Uzzah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Shimea, his son Haggiah, and his son Asaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men to whom David handed responsibility for music in the Temple of the Lord, after the ark came to rest there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They ministered in song in front of the Tent of Meeting, until Solomon had built the Temple of the Lord in Jerusalem. They served in accordance with orders of service designated for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men who served, including their descendants: From the descendants of Kohath, there was Heman the singer, who had been fathered by Joel, who had been fathered by Samuel,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Elkanah, who had been fathered by Jeroham, who had been fathered by Eliel, who had been fathered by Toah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Zuph, who had been fathered by Elkanah, who had been fathered by Mahath, who had been fathered by Amasai,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Elkanah, who had been fathered by Joel, who had been fathered by Azariah, who had been fathered by Zephaniah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Tahath, who had been fathered by Assir, who had been fathered by Ebiasaph, who had been fathered by Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Izhar, who had been fathered by Kohath, who had been fathered by Levi, who had been fathered by Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was also his brother Asaph, who stood to Heman’s right. Asaph had been fathered by Berechiah, who had been fathered by Shimea,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Michael, who had been fathered by Baaseiah, who had been fathered by Malchijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Ethni, who had been fathered by Zerah, who had been fathered by Adaiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Ethan, who had been fathered by Zimmah, who had been fathered by Shimei,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Jahath, who had been fathered by Gershom, and who had been fathered by Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: To Heman’s left were their relatives who were Merari’s sons: Ethan, who had been fathered by Kishi, who had been fathered by Abdi, who had been fathered by Malluch,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Hashabiah, who had been fathered by Amaziah, who had been fathered by Hilkiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Amzi, who had been fathered by Bani, who had been fathered by Shemer,
speaker: Narrator

text: who had been fathered by Mahli, who had been fathered by Mushi, who had been fathered by Merari, who had been fathered by Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with their relatives, descendants of Levi who had been appointed for all the service of the tent of the Temple of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, Aaron and his sons presented offerings on the altar of burnt offering and on the altar of incense, carrying out the work of the Most Holy Place, making atonement for Israel in accordance with everything that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are Aaron’s sons: his son Eleazar, his son Phinehas, his son Abishua,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Bukki, his son Uzzi, his son Zerahiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Meraioth, his son Amariah, his son Ahitub,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Zadok, and his son Ahimaaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the settlement locations allotted within their borders to Aaron’s descendants in the Kohathite clan since the lot was cast in their favor first.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hebron in the territory of Judah was allotted to them, along with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fields adjacent to the city and its villages were allotted to Jephunneh’s son Caleb.
speaker: Narrator

text: They allotted these cities of refuge to the descendants of Aaron: Hebron, Libnah with its surrounding suburbs, Jattir, Eshtemoa with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hilen with its surrounding suburbs, Debir with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashan with its surrounding suburbs, and Beth-shemesh with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Benjamin were allotted Geba with its surrounding suburbs, Alemeth with its surrounding suburbs, and Anathoth with its surrounding suburbs. All their towns allotted to their families totaled thirteen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten towns were allocated to the rest of the descendants of Kohath by lot out of the family of the tribe, that is, the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the descendants of Gershom according to their families were allotted 13 towns in Bashan from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Merari were allotted 12 towns according to their families from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people of Israel gave the descendants of Levi the towns with their surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: allocating these towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: A few of the families of Kohath’s descendants had towns of their territory allotted from the tribe of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were given these cities of refuge: Shechem with its surrounding suburbs in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jokmeam with its surrounding suburbs, Beth-horon with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with its surrounding suburbs, Gath-rimmon with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: and (from of the half-tribe of Manasseh), Aner with its surrounding suburbs, and Bileam with its surrounding suburbs for the rest of the Kohathite families.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh the descendants of Gershom were allotted Golan in Bashan with its surrounding suburbs and Ashtaroth with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Issachar were allotted Kedesh with its surrounding suburbs, Daberath with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ramoth with its surrounding suburbs, and Anem with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From of the tribe of Asher were allotted Mashal with its surrounding suburbs, Abdon with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hukok with its surrounding suburbs, and Rehob with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Naphtali were allotted Kedesh in Galilee with its surrounding suburbs, Hammon with its surrounding suburbs, and Kiriathaim with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Zebulun the rest of the descendants of Merari were allotted Rimmono with its surrounding suburbs, and Tabor with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: across the Jordan from Jericho, that is, on the east side of the Jordan, from the tribe of Reuben were allotted Bezer in the steppe with its surrounding suburbs, Jahzah with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with its surrounding suburbs, and Mephaath with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Gad were allotted Ramoth in Gilead with its surrounding suburbs, Mahanaim with its surrounding suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with its surrounding suburbs, and Jazer with its surrounding suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The four descendants of Issachar included Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tola’s descendants included Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, leaders of their ancestral house of Tola, who were valiant warriors during their lifetimes. During the life of David, they numbered 22,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzi fathered Izrahiah, and Izrahiah fathered Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah, all five of them leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition to them, according to their ancestral records were 36,000 members of their trained army by their generations, because they had many wives and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: As recorded in their genealogy, a total of 87,000 trained warriors belonged to all of the clans of Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin’s three descendants included Bela, Becher, and Jediael.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela’s five descendants included Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, who were leaders of their ancestral households. Valiant warriors, their enrollment totaled 22,034 according to their genealogies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Becher’s descendants included Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were descendants of Becher,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their genealogical enrollment totaled 20,200 valiant warriors, delineated according to their generations as leaders of their ancestral households.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jediael fathered Bilhan, and Bilhan’s descendants included Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were descendants through Jediael according to the heads of their ancestral households. Their valiant warriors totaled 17,200 equipped and ready for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition, Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir, and the Hushites were descended from Aher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naphtali’s descendants included Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, descended through Bilhah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Manasseh’s descendants included Asriel, whom his Aramean mistress bore, along with Machir, who fathered Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Machir chose wives for his sons Huppim and for Shuppim. He had a sister named Maacah. His second son was named Zelophehad, and Zelophehad fathered only daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Machir’s wife Maacah bore a son whom she named Peresh. His brother was named Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rekem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ulam’s son was Bedan. These were the children of Machir’s son Gilead, who was also a descendant of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: His sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemida’s sons included Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ephraim’s descendants included Shuthelah, his son Bered, his son Tahath, his son Eleadah, his son Tahath,
speaker: Narrator

text: his son Zabad, his son Shuthelah, his son Ezer, and Elead. The people of Gath, who were native to the land, killed them when they came down to raid their cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So their father Ephraim mourned many days, and his relatives came to comfort him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, Ephraim had marital relations with his wife, and she conceived and gave birth to a son, whom he named Beriah, because his household had been visited with disaster.
speaker: Narrator

text: His daughter Sheerah built both Lower and Upper Beth-horon, along with Uzzen-sheerah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rephah was also his descendant, as were Resheph, Telah, Tahan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ladan, Ammihud, Elishama,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nun, and Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their possessions and settlements included Bethel and its towns, Naaran to the east, Gezer and its towns to the west, Shechem and its towns as far as Ayyah and its towns
speaker: Narrator

text: along the borders of the descendants of Manasseh, Beth-shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. In these lived the descendants of Israel’s son Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asher’s descendants included Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beriah’s descendants included Heber and Malchiel, who fathered Birzaith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heber fathered Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Japhlet’s descendants included Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were the descendants of Japhlet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemer’s descendants included Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
speaker: Narrator

text: His brother Helem’s descendants included Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zophah’s descendants included Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jether’s descendants included Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ulla’s descendants included Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were men of Asher, leaders of ancestral households, choice valiant mighty warriors, and chiefs among princes. Their enrolled genealogies for battle conscription totaled 26,000 men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benjamin fathered Bela his firstborn, Ashbel his second born, Aharah his third born,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nohah his fourth born, and Rapha his fifth born.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bela’s descendants included Addar, Gera, Abihud,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ehud’s descendants, who were leaders of their ancestral households in Geba and who were taken into exile to Manahath, included:
speaker: Narrator

text: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera (also known as Heglam), who fathered Uzza and Ahihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaharaim fathered sons in the land of Moab after he had divorced his wives Hushim and Baara.
speaker: Narrator

text: By his wife Hodesh he fathered Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeuz, Sachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons and leaders of ancestral households.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also fathered his sons Abitub and Elpaal by Hushim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elpaal’s descendants included Eber, Misham, Shemed (who built Ono and Lod, along with its towns),
speaker: Narrator

text: Beriah and Shema, leaders of ancestral households in Aijalon who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebadiah, Arad, and Eder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beriah’s descendants included Michael, Ishpah, and Joha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elpaal’s descendants included Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei’s descendants included Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shashak’s descendants included Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Iphdeiah, and Penuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeroham’s descendants included Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of these were the leaders of ancestral households, chiefs according to their generations. They lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel the father of Gibeon lived in Gibeon, and his wife was named Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mikloth, who fathered Shimeah. Now these also lived with their relatives across town in Jerusalem from their other relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner fathered Kish, Kish fathered Saul, Saul fathered Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonathan fathered Merib-baal and Merib-baal fathered Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah’s descendants included Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz fathered Jehoaddah and Jehoaddah fathered Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri fathered Moza.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza fathered Binea, and Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six sons. Their names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan—all of these were the sons of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of his brother Eshek included Ulam his firstborn, Jeush his second, and Eliphelet his third.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ulam’s descendants were valiant warriors and archers. They had 150 children and grandchildren, all descendants of Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of Israel was enumerated by genealogy and recorded in the Book of the Kings of Israel as Judah was being taken captive into exile to Babylon due to their disobedience.
speaker: Narrator

text: The first to settle on their own property in their own towns of Israel were priests, descendants of Levi, and the Temple Servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Jerusalem there lived some of the people of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh including
speaker: Narrator

text: Ammihud’s son Uthai, who was the grandson of Omri, who was the great-grandson of Imri, who was fathered by Bani from the descendants of Judah’s son Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Shilon there was Asaiah the firstborn, along with his descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Zerah there was Jeuel, along with 690 of their relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Benjamin there was Meshullam’s son Sallu, who was also the grandson of Hodaviah and great-grandson of Hassenuah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeroham’s son Ibneiah, Uzzi’s son Elah, who was also Michri’s grandson, and Shephatiah’s son Meshullam, who was the grandson of Reuel and great-grandson of Ibnijah,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with 956 of their relatives according to their generations. All of these were leaders of families according to their ancestral households.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the priests there were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hilkiah’s son Azariah, who was fathered by Meshullam, who was fathered by Zadok, who was fathered by Meraioth, who was fathered by Ahitub, the Chief Operating Officer of the Temple of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was Jeroham’s son Adaiah, who was fathered by Pashhur, who was fathered by Malchijah, and Adiel’s son Maasai, who was fathered by Jahzerah, who was fathered by Meshullam, who was fathered by Meshillemith, who was fathered by Immer,
speaker: Narrator

text: along with 1,760 of their relatives, who were leaders of their ancestral households, valiant and qualified to serve in the Temple of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the descendants of Levi there was Hasshub’s son Shemaiah, who was the grandson of Azrikam, who was fathered by Hashabiah, from the descendants of Merari;
speaker: Narrator

text: along with Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mica’s son Mattaniah, who was the grandson of Zichri and great-grandson of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Shemaiah’s son Obadiah, who was the grandson of Galal, who was fathered by Jeduthun, and Asa’s son Berechiah, who was the grandson of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeepers included Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and other relatives. Shallum was the leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: He used to be stationed in the King’s Gate on the east side as one of the gatekeepers of the camp belonging to the descendants of Levi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kore’s son Shallum, who was the grandson of Ebiasaph and the great-grandson of Korah, and the descendants of Korah (who were relatives of his ancestral house) were over the service responsibilities and served as guardians of the entrances of the Tent, just as their ancestors had been in charge of the camp of the Lord and guardians of the entrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar’s son Phinehas used to be Commander-in-Chief over them—the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meshelemiah’s son Zechariah was gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All these, who had been set apart as gatekeepers at the entrances, numbered 212 and had been enrolled by genealogies in their villages.
David and Samuel the seer installed them in their positions of trust,
speaker: Narrator

text: so they and their descendants were in charge of the gates of the house of the Lord, that is, the House of the Tent, as guardians.
speaker: Narrator

text: The guardians were stationed on four sides—east, west, north, and south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their relatives who lived in their villages were required to visit every seven days to be with them in turn,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the four senior gatekeepers (who were descendants of Levi) had been placed in charge of the chambers and the treasury of the Temple of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spent the night near the Temple of God, since they had been entrusted to guard it. They were in charge of opening it every morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some were responsible for the service utensils, and they were required to take an inventory of them when they were brought in and out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were responsible for the furniture and for all of the holy utensils, including the flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other descendants of the priests prepared the mixed spices.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mattithiah, a descendant of Levi and firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of making the offering cakes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of their Kohathite relatives were responsible to prepare the rows of bread for each Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: These singers, leaders of ancestral households of the descendants of Levi, were living in the chambers of the Temple. Freed from other service responsibilities, they were on duty day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text: These leaders of the descendants of Levi, enrolled according to their genealogies, lived in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeiel, who fathered Gibeon, lived in the city of Gibeon. His wife was named Maacah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mikloth fathered Shimeam. They lived across town from their relatives in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ner fathered Kish, Kish fathered Saul, and Saul fathered Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonathan fathered Merib-baal, and Merib-baal fathered Micah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Micah’s descendants included Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahaz fathered Jarah, and Jarah fathered Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri fathered Moza, and
speaker: Narrator

text: Moza fathered Binea, and Rephaiah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Azel had six descendants with these names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan—these were the descendants of Azel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines were fighting against Israel, and each soldier of Israel fled before the Philistines. They fell slain on the mountain of Gilboa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines followed after Saul and after his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, Saul’s sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heaviest fighting was against Saul, and when the archers who were shooting located Saul, he was gravely wounded by them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saul ordered his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through with it, or these uncircumcised people will come and abuse me.”
But his armor bearer did not want to do it because he was very frightened, so Saul took the sword and fell on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell on his sword and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Saul, his three sons, and all his entire household died together.
speaker: Narrator

text: When that part of the army of Israel that was in the valley saw that the rest of the army of Israel had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and fled, and the Philistines came and occupied them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines came to strip the dead the next day, and they found Saul dead on Gilboa mountain, along with his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stripped him, took his head and armor, and sent messengers throughout the territory of the Philistines to report the news to their idols and to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they put Saul’s armor in the temple of their gods and fastened his skull to the wall of the temple of Dagon.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the residents of Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,
speaker: Narrator

text: every valiant soldier got up, removed the bodies of Saul and his sons, took them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the tamarisk tree in Jabesh. Then they fasted for seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Saul died for his transgressions; that is, he acted unfaithfully to the Lord by transgressing the message from the Lord (which he did not keep), by consulting a medium for advice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and by not seeking counsel from the Lord, who therefore put him to death and turned the kingdom over to Jesse’s son David.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later on, all of Israel gathered together at Hebron in order to tell David, “Look, we’re your own flesh and blood!
speaker: Narrator

text: Even back when Saul was ruling as king, you kept on leading the army of Israel out to battle and bringing them in again. The Lord your God told you, ‘You yourself will shepherd my people Israel and will be Commander-in-Chief over my people Israel.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the elders of Israel approached the king at Hebron, where David entered into a covenant in the presence of the Lord. Then they anointed David to be king over Israel, just as the Lord had sent word through Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, David and all of Israel marched to Jerusalem (then known as Jebus, where the Jebusites lived when they inhabited the land).
speaker: Narrator

text: The inhabitants of Jebus told David, “You’re not coming in here!” Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion, now known as the City of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David had announced, “Whoever first attacks the Jebusites will be appointed chief and commander.” When Zeruiah’s son Joab went up first, he became chief.
speaker: Narrator

text: David occupied the fortress, so it was named the City of David after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built up the walls surrounding the city in a complete circle from the terrace ramparts, and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: David became more and more prestigious because the Lord of the Heavenly Armies was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the leaders of the elite warriors who were strong supporters of David in his kingdom, along with all of Israel, in keeping with the message from the Lord concerning Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: This record of the warriors who were for David included Hachmoni’s son Jashobeam, leader of the platoons, who killed 300 with his spear in a single encounter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to him among the Three Warriors was Dodo the Ahohite’s son Eleazar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was with David at Pas-dammim when the Philistines were there to engage them in battle. There was a field planted with barley, and the army had run away from the Philistines,
speaker: Narrator

text: but they took a defensive stand in the middle of the field and killed the Philistines while the Lord saved them by means of a great victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, the Three Warriors went down to David’s hideout at the cave of Adullam when the Philistine army was camping in the valley of giants.
speaker: Narrator

text: David was living in that stronghold at the time, while a Philistine garrison was then at Bethlehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: David expressed a longing, “Oh, how I wish someone would get me a drink of water from the Bethlehem well that’s by the city gate!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Three Warriors broke through the Philistine ranks, drew some water from the Bethlehem well that was next to the city gate, and brought it back to David. But David refused to drink it, poured it out in the Lord’s presence, and
speaker: Narrator

text: said in response, “May God forbid me to do this! I won’t drink the blood of these men, will I? After all, they risked their lives to bring it to me.” That’s why he wouldn’t drink it. The Three Warriors did these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joab’s brother Abishai was the lieutenant in charge of the platoons. He used his spear to fight and kill 300 men, gaining a reputation distinct from the Three.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was more well-known than the Three, but he never attained the stature of the Three.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada’s son Benaiah, who was a valiant man, accomplished great things. He was from Kabzeel. He killed two men named Ariel from Moab and then he also went down into a pit and struck down a lion during a snow storm one day.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also killed a soldier from Egypt of enormous height—five cubits tall. The Egyptian carried a spear comparable in size to a weaver’s beam, but Benaiah attacked him with a staff, snatched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand and killed him with his own spear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Benaiah did things like this and gained a reputation comparable to the Three Warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was well known among the platoons, but he didn’t measure up to the Three Warriors. David placed him in charge of his security detail.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elite forces included Asahel (Joab’s brother), Dodo’s son Elhanan from Bethlehem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shammoth from Haror, Helez the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ikkesh’s son Ira from Tekoa, Abiezer from Anathoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maharai from Netophah, Baanah’s son Heled from Netophah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ribai’s son Ithai from Gibeah, controlled by the descendants of Benjamin, Benaiah of Pirathon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hurai from the wadis of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Azmaveth from Baharum, Eliahba from Shaalbon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hashem the Gizonite, Shagee the Hararite’s son Jonathan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Sachar the Hararite’s son Ahiam, Ur’s son Eliphal,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezro from Carmel, Ezbai’s son Naarai,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joel (Nathan’s brother), Hagri’s son Mibhar,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai from Beeroth, who was the armor-bearer for Zeruiah’s son Joab,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uriah the Hittite, Ahlai’s son Zabad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shiza the Reubenite’s son Adina, a leader of the descendants of Reuben, along with thirty others with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maacah’s son Hanan, Joshaphat the Mithnite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Hotham the Aroerite’s sons Shama and Jeiel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimri’s son Jediael and his brother Joha the Tizite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel the Mahavite, Elnaam’s sons Jeribai and Joshaviah, Ithmah the Moabite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here’s a list of those who came to David at Ziklag when he was unable to travel freely due to Saul son of Kish. They were among the elite soldiers who assisted him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Equipped as archers, they could use both their right and left hands to shoot arrows and hurl stones. As descendants of Benjamin, they were Saul’s relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their leaders were Shemaah’s sons Ahiezer and Joash from Gibeah, Azmaveth’s sons Jeziel and Pelet, Beracah, Jehu from Anathoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ishmaiah from Gibeon (who was one of the elite among the Thirty and in charge over them), Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, Jozabad from Gederah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, Shephatiah the Haruphite,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, Jashobeam, the descendants of Korah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jeroham’s sons Joelah and Zebadiah from Gedor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mighty and experienced warriors from the descendants of Gad joined David at his wilderness stronghold. They were expert handlers of both shield and spear, with hardened looks and as agile as a gazelle on a mountain slope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their leader was Ezer, Obadiah was second, Eliab third,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mishmannah fourth, Jeremiah fifth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Attai sixth, Eliel seventh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Johanan eighth, Elzabad ninth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jeremiah tenth, and Machbannai eleventh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These descendants of Gad were army leaders. The least of them was equal to a hundred other soldiers and the greatest to a thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men crossed the Jordan in the first month of the year during flood season and chased out everyone in the valleys, to the east and to the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, some descendants of Benjamin and Judah approached David at his stronghold,
speaker: Narrator

text: and David went out to meet them. He told them, “If you’ve come in peace to be of help to me, then you’ll have my commitment. But if you’ve come to betray me to my enemies, even though I’m innocent of wrongdoing, then may the God of our ancestors watch and judge.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, leader of the Thirty, and he said,
“David, we belong to you;
    we’re with you, son of Jesse!
Peace, peace to you,
    and peace to the one who helps you!
        For your deliverer is your God.”
So David received them and assigned them to be officers over troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the descendants of Manasseh joined David when he was going to fight against Saul, accompanied by the Philistines. Even so, David was of no help to them, because the Philistine rulers were counseled to send him away. They told themselves, “He’s going to go over to his master Saul at the cost of our heads.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he traveled toward Ziklag, these descendants of Manasseh joined him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, leaders in charge thousands in Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They helped David against raiders, since they were all warriors and commanders in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed people kept coming to David every day to help him, until his army became a great, vast army.
speaker: Narrator

text: What follows is a listing of the divisions of battle-ready troops who joined David in Hebron to turn the kingdom of Saul over to him, in accordance with what the Lord had spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: The army of Judah, equipped with both shields and spears, numbered 6,800 warriors,
speaker: Narrator

text: the elite warriors of Simeon numbered 7,100,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the descendants of Levi numbered 4,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehoiada, a senior officer in the house of Aaron, brought with him 3,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zadok, a young and valiant soldier, brought 22 commanders from his own ancestral house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Benjamin, relatives of Saul numbered 3,000, of whom most had remained allied to what remained of Saul’s dynasty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Ephraim supplied 20,800 valiant soldiers who were well known in their ancestral households.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half-tribe of Manasseh supplied 18,000, who had been appointed specifically to come and establish David as king.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Issachar supplied 200 leaders, along with all of their relatives under their command. They kept up-to-date in their understanding of the times and knew what Israel should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Zebulun supplied 50,000 experienced troops, trained in the use of every kind of war weapon, in order to help David with undivided loyalty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Naphtali supplied 1,000 commanders, accompanied by 37,000 troops armed with shields and spears.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Dan supplied 28,600 battle-ready troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Asher supplied 40,000 experienced, battle-ready troops.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribes of Reuben and Gad, along with the half-tribe of Manasseh east of the Jordan supplied 120,000 men armed with every kind of war weapon.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these warriors arrived in battle order at Hebron, fully intending to establish David as king over all Israel. Furthermore, all of the rest of Israel were united in their intent to make David king.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spent three days eating and drinking with David, since their relatives had supplied provisions for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their neighbors came from as far away as the territories of Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, bringing provisions loaded on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen. They brought abundant provisions of meal, fig bars, raisins, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep, because there was joy in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later, David conferred with every officer in charge of groups of thousands and groups of hundreds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he addressed the entire community of Israel, “If it seems good to you and something from the Lord our God, let’s spread word to all of our relatives who remain throughout the entire land of Israel, including the priests and descendants of Levi in the cities and pasture lands, so they can gather together with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then let’s bring the Ark of God back to us, because we didn’t consult it during Saul’s reign.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The entire community consented, because doing so pleased all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So David assembled all of Israel—from the Shihor River of Egypt to Lebo-hamath—in order to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: David, accompanied by all of Israel, went up to Baalah (the former name of Kiriath-jearim), which belonged to Judah, to bring from there the Ark of God, the Lord, who sits enthroned on the cherubim, and who is called the Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They mounted the Ark of God on a new cart, bringing it from Abinadab’s home, with Uzzah and Ahio driving the cart.
speaker: Narrator

text: David and all of Israel were dancing in the presence of God with all of their might with songs, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they approached Chidon’s threshing floor, Uzzah put out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen had stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then, the anger of the Lord blazed against Uzzah, and he struck him down because he had put his hand on the ark, and he died right there in the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: David flew into a rage because the Lord had killed Uzzah. As a result, that place was called Perez-uzzah to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But David feared God that day, and asked “How am I to bring the Ark of God to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, David would not take the ark into the City of David for it to be in his care. Instead, he took it to the home of Obed-edom the Gittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Ark of God remained in the care of Obed-edom’s household for three months, and God blessed Obed-edom’s household, along with everyone associated with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, King Hiram of Tyre sent a delegation to David, accompanied by cedar logs, stone masons, and wood workers, to construct a palace for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: David realized that the Lord was affirming him as king over Israel, and that his government was being exalted in order to benefit his people Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while he was living in Jerusalem, David married more wives and fathered more sons and daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Here’s a list of the children whom he fathered while in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Philistines learned that David had been anointed king over all of Israel, all of the Philistines invaded to look for David. David heard about it and went out to fight them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, the Philistines had invaded and raided the Rephaim Valley.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So David asked God, “Am I to go out against the Philistines? Will you give me victory over them?”
“Go out,” the Lord replied to him, “and I’ll put them right into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David went out to Baal-perazim and defeated the Philistines there. David observed, “Like an overwhelming flood, God has overwhelmed my enemies, using me to do it.” That’s why that place is called Baal-perazim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Philistines abandoned their gods there, so David ordered that their idols be incinerated.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later the Philistines invaded the Rephaim Valley again.
speaker: Narrator

text: When David asked God about it, God told him, “Don’t directly attack them. Instead, go around them and come up against them opposite those balsam trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear the sound of marching coming from the tops of the balsam trees, then go out to battle, because God will have gone out ahead of you to destroy the Philistine army.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So David did just as God had ordered, and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gezer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David’s reputation spread through all of the neighboring countries, and the Lord caused all nations to be afraid of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David built palaces for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the Ark of God and erected a tent for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David ordered that the Ark of God was to be carried by no one except the descendants of Levi, because the Lord had chosen them to carry the ark of the Lord and to serve him forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: David assembled all of Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the ark of the Lord to its proper place that he had prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also assembled the descendants of Aaron, who were descendants of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: including Uriel their leader from the descendants of Kohath, along with 120 of his relatives,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the descendants of Merari, Asaiah their leader, along with 220 of his relatives,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the descendants of Gershom, Joel their chief, along with 130 of his relatives,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the descendants of Elizaphan, Shemaiah their leader, along with 200 of his relatives,
speaker: Narrator

text: from Hebron’s descendants, Eliel their leader, along with 80 of his relatives,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Uzziel’s descendants, Amminadab their leader, along with 112 of his relatives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar, along with the descendants of Levi Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab
speaker: Narrator

text: and addressed them: “As leaders of your Levitical families, set yourselves apart, both you and your relatives, so you can be qualified to bring up the ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place I’ve prepared for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you didn’t carry it from the very first, the Lord our God attacked us, since we didn’t care for it appropriately.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the priests and descendants of Levi set themselves apart to carry the ark of the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Levi carried the Ark of God the way Moses had commanded and in accordance with the command from the Lord—that is, with poles on their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also told the leaders of the descendants of Levi to appoint their relatives as singers, to play musical instruments such as harps, lyres, and cymbals, and to keep sounding aloud with joyful voices.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the descendants of Levi appointed Joel’s son Heman, his relative Berechiah’s son Asaph, as well as certain relatives of Merari’s sons, including Kushaiah’s son Ethan,
speaker: Narrator

text: their second order relatives Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, as well as the trustees Obed-edom and Jeiel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The singers included Heman, Asaph, and Ethan (who played bronze cymbals).
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played harps to accompany the women singers,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah led on lyres, sounding the octaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chenaniah, music leader for the descendants of Levi, served as music director, because he was expert at it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Berechiah and Elkanah served as gatekeepers for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests were appointed to sound the trumpets before the Ark of God, and Obed-edom and Jehiah were trustees for the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David, the elders of Israel, and the leaders of groups of thousands proceeded to bring the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord from Obed-edom’s house, rejoicing as they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: As God helped the descendants of Levi who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: David wore a robe made from fine linen, as did all of the descendants of Levi who were carrying the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah the music and choir director. David also wore a linen ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of Israel were bringing up the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, accompanied by shouting, sounding of horns, trumpets, and cymbals, along with loud music on harps and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord approached the City of David, Saul’s daughter Michal was peering out a window, watching King David dancing and cavorting around, and she despised him in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the Ark of God, placed it within the tent that David had erected, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings in the presence of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: After David had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: and distributed a loaf of bread, a date bar, and a raisin bar to every person in Israel—that is, to each man and to each woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of the ark of the Lord, he appointed some of the descendants of Levi to minister continually by remembering, giving thanks, and praising the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their director Asaph played cymbals, and next to him was Zechariah, followed by Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, who played harps and lyres.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests Benaiah and Jahaziel played the trumpets continually in the presence of the Ark of the Covenant of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that very day, David composed this psalm of thanksgiving to the Lord just for Asaph and his companions:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord,
    calling on his name.
        Make what he has done known among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to him,
    sing psalms to him,
        and think about all of his miraculous deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Find joy in his holy name;
    let the hearts of those who keep on seeking the Lord rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and his strength.
    Always look to him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep remembering the awesome deeds that he has done,
    along with his miracles
        and the rulings that he has handed down,
speaker: Narrator

text:
you descendants of his servant Israel,
    you descendants of Jacob,
        the ones he has chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God.
    His justice is in all of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember his covenant forever,
    his promise that he made to the thousandth generation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the covenant that he made with Abraham,
    and the oath he swore to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He confirmed it to Jacob in the form of an ordinance,
    an eternal covenant to Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
when he told Israel,
    “To you I will give the land of Canaan
        as your joyful inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you were few in number—
    very few, and strangers at that—
speaker: Narrator

text:
wandering from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he did not let anyone wrong them.
    He warned kings on their behalf,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Don’t touch my chosen ones,
    and don’t hurt my prophets!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all the earth sing to the Lord!
    Day after day proclaim his deliverance!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare his glory among the nations,
    and his miraculous deeds to all people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
because the Lord is great,
    and he is praised greatly!
        He is feared above every god.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all of the gods of the other nations are mere idols,
    but the Lord fashioned the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Splendor and majesty surround him,
    and strength and joy fill his palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the families of earth recognize the Lord—
    that he is glorious and powerful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Recognize the glory that is due the Lord!
    Bring your offering,
and come into his presence,
    worshiping the Lord in all of his holy splendor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble in his presence, all the earth!
    Surely the inhabited world stands firm—
        it cannot be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the heavens rejoice,
    and the earth be glad!
Say to the nations,
    “The Lord reigns!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the sea roar
    along with everything that fills it!
Let the fields exult,
    along with everything in them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then let the trees in the forest sing out in praise,
    for the Lord is coming to judge the world.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord,
    because he is good
        and because his gracious love is eternal!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Call out, “Save us, God, you who delivers us!
    Gather us and rescue us from the nations!”
We will thank your holy name
    and rejoice as we praise you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord God of Israel,
    who lives from eternity to eternity!
Then all of the people shouted “Amen!” and praised the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later David left the presence of the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord so Asaph and his fellow descendants of Levi could serve the ark there continually each day, doing whatever was required.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obed-edom and 68 of his relatives remained also, with Jeduthun’s son Obed-edom and Hosah serving as trustees.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Zadok the priest and his relatives at the Tent of the Lord at the high place in Gibeon, where they ministered in the Lord’s presence,
speaker: Narrator

text: sacrificing the regular burnt offerings regularly each morning and evening to the Lord on the altar dedicated to that purpose, doing everything written in the Law of the Lord, just as he had commanded Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: David also appointed Heman, Jeduthun, and others chosen by name to give thanks to the Lord, because “his gracious love is eternal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They accompanied their songs of praise to God with trumpets, cymbals, and other musical instruments while Jeduthun’s children served as trustees.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, everyone left for their own homes and David went home to bless his own household.
speaker: Narrator

text: After David had settled down to live in his palace, he spoke with the prophet Nathan. “Look, here I am living in this cedar palace, but the ark of the Lord’s covenant remains surrounded by curtains!”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do everything you have in mind,” Nathan replied to David, “because God is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But later that same night, this message came to Nathan from God:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Go tell David, my servant, ‘This is what the Lord says: 
“‘“You won’t be building a house for me to inhabit, will you?
speaker: Narrator

text: After all, I haven’t lived in a house from the day I brought out Israel until today. Instead, I’ve lived from tent to tent and from one place to another.
speaker: Narrator
